==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology===
Cantonese word for "squat":
:Guangzhou ''mɐu⁵³'', Conghua ''mou⁵⁵'', Panyu (Shiqiao) ''mɐu⁵⁵'', Zengcheng ''pɐu⁵⁵'', Shunde (Daliang) ''mɐu⁵³'', {{w|Zhuhai}} (Qianshan) ''pɐu⁵⁵'', Kaiping (Chikan) ''vau³³'', {{w|Taishan}} ''peu³³'', Nanhai (Shatou) ''mɐu⁵⁵'', Jiangmen (Baisha) ''mou²³'', Hong Kong ({{w|Kam Tin}}) ''məu⁵⁵'', Macau ''pɐu⁵⁵''.

Etymology not certain. Perhaps a Tai-Kadai substrate word; compare {{cog|za|maeuq||to squat}}. Also compare {{zh-l|䠐|tr=ŋɨu<sup>H</sup>|to squat}}. Others believe this is from Mandarin {{zh-l|*貓|tr=māo|cat > to bend; to bend down}}, as in colloquial Mandarin {{zh-l|*貓腰|to bend down}}, although this may be less likely due to the semantic mismatch ("squat" and "bend down").
